title: Château d'Ollières 2017 Prestige Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)
description: This pale, grey-pink-colored wine is lively with red-fruit flavors and plenty of acidity. Its crisp texture is immediately refreshing, giving great fruitiness, a tight mineral texture and a bright aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Château Grand Boise 2017 Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)
description: Ripe and creamy, this seemingly soft wine has a kick of tannin as well as acidity that gives it a good structure, allowing it to go well with food. Showing the extra density of a Sainte Victoire wine, it has weight at the end. Drink now.

title: Château Paradis 2015 Red (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)
description: With 50% Cabernet Sauvignon, this rich and structured wine has firm tannins, juicy black-currant and spice flavors and a full pepper and ripe fruit texture. Even after three years, it is still young. Don't drink before 2021.

title: Château Roquefeuille 2017 Cuvée R Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: The bottle, resembling the skittle you find in a bowling alley, houses a soft wine, full of ripe strawberry fruit, gentle acidity and a warm, full texture. The wine is easy, generous, with an attractive tang at the end to give it a lift.

title: Chateau St. Jean 2016 Chardonnay (California)
description: Spicy and oaky in a delicious measured way, this full-bodied and nicely balanced wine backs up the toast, butter and bread dough aromas with generous ripe apple, pear and toasted-almond flavors for a complex and complete picture.

title: Clouds Rest 2014 Allure Reserve Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is made from grapes grown within the Petaluma Gap, now an appellation of its own. Heady notions of apple and pear rise on the nose, with seasonings of nutmeg and butterscotch emanating from the toasted oak. The lemon-curd-like richness is well-contained.

title: Damiani 2016 Sunrise Hill Vineyards Lemberger (Finger Lakes)
description: Sourced from a single vineyard on the western side of Cayuga Lake, this Lemberger displays the ripeness and structure that is possible in warm, dry vintages like 2016. In its youth, this is wearing its nine month Hungarian oak aging on its sleeve, however at its core is a dense concentration of blackberry, dark cherry and warm spice. The medium-bodied palate is bolstered by a fine grip of tannins and juicy acidity, with loads of crunchy berry flavors broadening the feel. Drink from 2020.

title: Der Pollerhof 2017 Frau Meyer Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)
description: Sage, yeast, moss and fern all appear on the savory nose. They re-appear with peppery subtlety on the light dry palate. This is archetypal, refreshing, easy Grüner with lots of flavor.

title: Domaine de la Bégude 2017 Cadet de la Bégude Red (Bandol)
description: This young, deep-purple-colored wine is almost the equivalent of a Bordeaux second wine. A blend across the two appellations of Côtes de Provence and Bandol, it has a rich potential, spicy, herbal while also packed with generous black fruits. The tannins will allow it to age, so save for 2019.

title: Domaine Gavoty 2017 Cuvée Clarendon Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: This stylish wine, made from old vines, is rich while well balanced with great strawberry flavors, acidity and a peppery aftertaste. Drink now. The wine is named after previous owner Bernard Gavoty, music critic for the French Le Figaro newspaper whose pseudonym was Clarendon.

title: Domaine la Rouillère 2017 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: With its ripe blend of five grapes including Mourvèdre and Cabernet Sauvignon, this wine has spice, perfume and tannins. Its acidity and flavors of almonds as well as red fruits are deliciously balanced. This estate's vineyard is in the hills at the heart of the Saint-Tropez peninsula. Drink the wine now.

title: Domäne Gobelsburg 2017 Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)
description: A salty touch of yeast appears briefly on the nose before green-pear notes take over. That salty pepperiness appears again fleetingly and teasingly on the very light, dry fresh palate, dominated by green-pear notes.

title: Folie à Deux 2014 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This is an expansively rich and layered wine, full bodied and bright in black cherry and blackberry, and with an underlying goodness of graham cracker crumble.

title: Gainey 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Green apples, freshly cut grass and slightly sweet white flowers invite the nose into this bottling, one of the best white wines for the money in the state. A strong grip grabs hold of the palate immediately, demanding attention for the ripe green-pear and tangy citrus flavors, all framed by powerful acidity.

title: Gassier 2017 Esprit Gassier Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: This is an intense, structured wine with great acidity as well as swathes of red fruits. A rich wine dominated by peppery Grenache, it also has a pure, red-currant flavor. The acidity is tight and refreshing. The wine will be better with food. Drink now.

title: Grey's Peak 2016 Pinot Noir (Waipara Valley)
description: Barnyard aromas quickly blow off and morphs into an earthy nose full of red and black berry, rhubarb, olives, baking spices and a charred, smoky character. Tannins are fine and gripping, wound around plum and earth flavors, yet the texture is satiny and surprisingly easygoing. Dusty oak notes creep in on the finish. Drink now–2024.

title: H.& C. Nittnaus 2017 Heideboden Grüner Veltliner (Burgenland)
description: A touch of yeast colors the sage and moss hints on the nose before lemon and green pear take over. It is lemon and pear that also play on the dry light palate. This is very refreshing, light and animating.

title: Johann Donabaum 2017 Johann Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)
description: Both ripe yellow pear and wet earthiness appear on the nose and morph into a very salty soy and miso-like savoriness on the light but fluid, almost soft palate. The dry finish has both pear and a touch of pepper.

title: Jules Taylor 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This is a fruity, opulent Sauvignon Blanc, bursting with peaches, pineapples, lychees, apple blossoms and just a hint of green leafiness. Oily-textured, with mouthwatering acidity and a long tomato leaf spice on the finish, this is one to satisfy both crisp, fruity white wine lovers and those who crave more body in their whites.

title: Keller 2017 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a lovely aromatic explosion of baked strawberry and peach that satisfies in its plucky fleshiness on the palate. Juicy and fresh, it's remarkably elegant and crowd-pleasing.

title: Kirkland Signature 2014 Meritage (Napa Valley)
description: This is a crazy deal for the quality, a blend of 47% Merlot, 32% Cabernet Sauvignon, 13% Cabernet Franc, 4% Petit Verdot and 4% Malbec. Sanguine, it offers a broad, expansive palate of polished tannin, cedar and crisp red fruit that's dusted in spicy clove and tobacco.

title: Marchesi Gondi 2012 Villa Bossi Riserva  (Chianti Rufina)
description: Made from 80% Sangiovese, 10% Colorino and 10% Cabernet Sauvignon, this savory red opens with dark-skinned berry, cedar and tobacco aromas. The structured palate offers blackberry jam, licorice and star anise flavors alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2023.

title: Mark Ryan 2015 Old Vines Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This is 100% Cabernet Sauvignon from Klipsun, Ciel du Cheval, Red Willow and Phinney Hill vineyards, The aromas are high toned on first pour, with the notes of cherry, spice, pencil lead and bay leaf not quite ready to reveal their charms but showing nuance over time. The flavors are tart and dry, showing a classic styling along with fine-grained tannins. It needs a few years in the cellar to settle in and stretch out.

title: Mark Ryan 2015 The Dissident Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This wine is a blend of 55% Cabernet Sauvignon, 28% Merlot, 16% Cabernet Franc and 1% Petit Verdot. Coming from top quality vineyards, the aromas are exuberant, with notes of blackberry, bittersweet chocolate and toast along with dried herb and luxurious barrel accents. The black-fruit flavors coat the palate, showing depth and intensity along with a firm tannic spine.

title: Markus Altenburger 2016 vom Kalk Blaufränkisch (Burgenland)
description: Dark, juicy and plump cherries on the nose carry right through to the palate where they are met with a snappy bright freshness that holds all of this pretty pure fruit in check. This is slightly rustic, even irreverent but it provides freshness, fun and verve. This honest fresh-faced wine will put a spring in your step.

title: Mas des Bressades 2017 Cuvée Tradition Rosé (Costières de Nîmes)
description: Initial whiffs of smoke and earth blow off to reveal bright red plum and bramble aromas here. Dry and refreshingly tart, it offers crisp raspberry and strawberry flavors nuanced by hints of garrigue and crushed stone. Drink now.

title: Michael David 2015 Earthquake Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This wine is big, broad and deep. There are wood-smoke and tobacco aromas along with blackberry and black-cherry flavors. The body is full and thick but there are soft tannins in the texture.

title: Millbrook 2016 Pinot Noir (New York)
description: This earthy Pinot Noir brings loads of forest floor, bramble berry and pepper spice to the fore. There's power and depth to the palate, with ripe berry fruit flavors that transition to a peppery, dry finish. A grip of tannins offers plenty of support. Drink from 2020 as this softens with age.

title: Montecappone 2016  Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico
description: This wine's wild herb, spring blossom and citrus aromas follow through to the savory palate, along with white peach, pear, green melon and citrus flavors. A white almond note closes the clean, tangy finish.
region_1: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

title: Neyers 2016 Left Bank Red (Napa Valley)
description: A 50-50 blend of Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon, this wine is robust in cedar, dried herb and peppercorn aromas and hints of flavor. Thick extracted layers of grippy texture are highlighted in blueberry and dark chocolate.
